summary: This document includes a subpoena duces tecum issued by the State Attorney's Office in Palm Beach County, Florida, requesting detailed call records from T-Mobile for a specific phone number. The document emphasizes the confidentiality of the request and the legal implications of disclosing the information. It also contains various call detail records and service details related to the account in question. This document contains a response to a subpoena issued to BellSouth for customer telephone records related to Jeffrey Epstein. It includes details about the records provided, the compliance process, and various charges associated with Epstein's account. The document highlights the legal obligations of BellSouth in responding to subpoenas and the nature of the records retrieved. This document appears to be a series of pages from a BellSouth customer service communication, detailing billing procedures, payment options, and service offerings. It includes information about handling billing discrepancies, returned check policies, and directory closing deadlines. There are no significant references to individuals involved in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Barry E. Krischer
persons.context: Barry E. Krischer is mentioned as the State Attorney overseeing the investigation and issuing the subpoena for call records.

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: A Detective is referenced in the context of conducting an official investigation related to the subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as the subscriber for the telephone account in question, with details of his billing and service records included in the document.

persons.name: Deborah Trautwein
persons.context: Deborah Trautwein is mentioned as the Compliance Assistant at BellSouth who handled the subpoena response and provided the requested customer records.

connections.description: Deborah Trautwein, as a Compliance Assistant at BellSouth, is responsible for managing the records related to Jeffrey Epstein's telephone service.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: A subpoena duces tecum was issued to T-Mobile requesting call records for a specific phone number.

events.title: Response to Subpoena
events.description: BellSouth provided customer telephone records for Jeffrey Epstein in response to a subpoena issued by the Palm Beach Police Department.

locations: 58 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480
keyFacts: The document is a subpoena duces tecum issued by the State Attorney's Office.
It requests detailed call records from T-Mobile for the phone number 931-317-2143.
The request emphasizes confidentiality and warns against disclosing the existence of the subpoena.
The document includes call detail records and service details related to the account in question.
The document is subject to a protective order.
The document includes a detailed account of charges and services associated with Jeffrey Epstein's telephone account.
Deborah Trautwein confirmed the retrieval of records in compliance with a legal subpoena.
The records provided were described as being kept in the course of regularly conducted business activity.
The document mentions various taxes and fees associated with the telephone service.
There are references to legal obligations and compliance processes for responding to subpoenas.
The document contains customer service information for BellSouth, including billing and payment procedures.
It mentions a returned check policy that may charge fees for insufficient funds.
There are deadlines for changes to telephone directory listings for various areas.
The document promotes bundled services and high-speed internet options from BellSouth.
No individuals related to the Epstein case are mentioned in this document.
